articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
I am originally from Lima, Peru, but largely grew up in Los Angeles. During my undergraduate education at California State University, Monterey Bay (CSUMB), I was part of the National Science Foundation’s Research Experience for Undergraduates program. I had the opportunity to work with Dr. Steve Litvin & Dr. Jim Barry at the Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute (MBARI) documenting the effects of future climate change on abalone. I presented the results of my research at conferences SACNAS and the Wildlife Society’s Annual Symposium in 2018.
I have volunteered with CSUMB-based non-profit Return of the Natives, where I aided an environmental education outreach program for 4th-5th graders and assisted with community planting events to restore native dune flora to the Monterey coast Now, I am working as a research assistant for Dr. Anastasia Quintana, helping with her postdoctoral research on MPA compliance in small-scale fisheries.

I am a huge animal lover and greatly enjoy being outdoors and in the field. I also previously volunteered at the UCSC Fort Ord National Reserve monitoring coastal horned lizard populations to inform the dissertation of Ph.D candidate, Danielle Davis.
I currently reside in Goleta, CA with my pet bunny and partner.
My pet bunnyInterests
I love being outdoors and exploring local trails. I have a particular affinity for surveying herptile communities (lizards, snakes, amphibians). My favorite field days were the ones where I had the opportunity to interact with native California wildlife and learn about their ecology and relevant conservation efforts. You can always find me in the field looking for cool snakes and lizards! Aside from that, I am highly passionate about environmental justice issues and I am an avid supporter of black & indigenous rights groups. I hope to apply my data analysis skills to serve underprivileged groups.
Me with a slender salamander

            I am a master’s student at the Bren School of Environmental Science & Management at UCSB, and I am specializing in Energy & Climate. I am currently working as a research assistant under Dr. Anastasia Quintana, aiding her postdoctoral research at the intersection of small-scale fisheries, conservation, and collective action.

       (818) 282-6200 |
      
       eneilson@bren.ucsb.edu |
      
      
      
      

      
      Education
      
      2015-2019 Seaside, California Bachelor of Environmental Science (California State University, Monterey Bay)
      
      
      In progress Santa Barbara, California Master of Environmental Science & Management (Bren School of Environmental Science & Management, UCSB)
      
      
      
      Research Experience
      Research Assistant (in progress) University of California, Santa Barbara Supervisor: Dr. Anastasia Quinatana
      Undergraduate Researcher (6/18-8/18)
      Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute (MBARI)
      Supervisors: Dr. Steve Litvin, Dr. Jim Barry
      Analyzed and quantified the effects of climate change and ocean acidification associated with upwelling on juvenile Haliotis rufescens (red abalone) through an 8-week active experiment for an NSF project
      Organized and updated Excel worksheets with experiment data of all 300+ individuals
      Conducted extensive image and statistical analysis using experimental data from 300+ individuals
      Presented results to audiences ranging from 5-200 people at various conferences and symposiums including SACNAS and the California Central Coast Chapter of The Wildlife Society’s Annual Symposium
      
      
      Field/Volunteer Experience
